intro: Arachnothryx michoacana, commonly known as the Michoacan arachnothryx, is a rare shrub native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
